src:
Devet poena za četvrtinu, problemi pod obručem i prvi Partizanov poraz u Evrokupu
Venecija slavila usred Beograda sa 83:69

05 Nov 2019

Partizanovoj seriji nepobedivosti u Evrokupu, nažalost, došao je kraj. Crno-beli su većeras u Areni naleteli na motivisanu, borbenu i pre svega čvrstu ekipu Venecije, koja je boljom igrom u reketu i sa nekoliko trojki u odlučujućoj, trećoj četvrtini uspela da crno-belima nanese prvi poraz u Evropi – 83:69.
Venecija je imala prednost na skoku tokom većeg dela susreta što je otežavalo posao košarkašima Partizana, jer su trošili dosta energije u defanzivi. Da sve bude još teže po crno-bele, Veneciju je sredinom treće četvrtine počeo da služi i šut. Upravo u tim trenucima, italijanska ekipa napravila je i ključnu razliku na ovoj utakmici koju je uspela da sačuva sve do samog kraja.
Večeras nije pomogla ni odlična partija Rašona Tomasa. Jednostavno, crno-beli su propustili previše prilika da ovaj meč odvedu u svom smeru i Venecija je sasvim zasluženo odnela pobedu.
Nešto sporije su košarkaši Partizana ušli u meč protiv Venecije. Čitava tri minuta crno-beli su čekali na prve poene kada je crnu seriju uspeo da prekine Ognjen Jaramaz pogotkom uz faul. Velike probleme imali su košarkaši domaće ekipe da sačuvaju loptu u reketu, pa su Italijani preko Vata i Udanoa uspeli da se odlepe na sasvim solidnu rezultatsku distancu.



Morao je Andrea Trinkijeri da prekine seriju Venecije već nakon pet minuta košarke. Iako su se crno-beli donekle konsolidovali u napadu, u odbrani je i dalje bilo velikih problema. Gostujući igrači nastavili su da dolaze do poena nakon ofanzivnog skoka.
Ipak, u samoj završnici prvog kvartala proradio je Partizanov šut sa distance, pa su crno-beli nakon trojki Zagorca i Pejdža, a potom i veoma teškog pogotka Pejnersa uz kontakt ipak završili prvi kvartal na pozitivnoj noti i imali svega tri poena zaostatka.
Nastavio je Partizan da igra sa istom energijom i na početku druge deonice. Venecija je doduše pokušala da mu parira, ali se videlo da polako počinje da gubi korak. Fantastičan tandem su u tim trenucima činili Žanis Pejners i Rašon Tomas koji su prvi put crno-bele odlepili na nešto osetniju rezultatsku prednost i naterali gostujućeg trenera Valtera de Rafaelea da zatraži tajmaut.
I on je urodio plodom, Venecija je uspela da uzvrati i u jednom trenutku dođe i do izjednačenja. Ipak, crno-beli su uspeli da se trgnu, ponovo počeli aktivno da pariraju italijanskom šampionu, pa su na velikom odmoru imali i dva poena prednosti – 39:37.























Početak drugog poluvremena kao da je bio preslikan u odnosu na prvo. Ponovo je Partizan pravio veliki broj grešaka kod građenja reketa, dozvoljavao je Veneciji da pokupi veliki broj ofanzivnih skokova, a to nije uspevao da koriguje na drugoj strani terena. Italijane je u trećoj deonici krenuo i šut, pa je Andrea Trinkijeri otprilike na polovini kvartala tražio tajmaut ne bi li nekako razmrdao svoje košarkaše.
Međutim, Venecija je energetski i dalje mnogo bolje stajala na terenu od košarkaša Partizana. Italijani su bili bolji i po zatraženom minutu odmora, krenuo ih je i šut sa distance, pa su brzo uspeli da se odlepe čak i na dvocifrenu razliku. Crno-beli su vrlo loši bili i na šutu sa linije za slobodna bacanja, što je gost masksimalno koristio. Pred poslednjih deset minuta košarke, Venecija je imala čak 14 poena prednosti – 48:62.
Iako su Mozli i Tomas dobrom energijom pokušali da trgnu crno-bele na startu poslednje deonice, Venecija je nastavila da odoleva i da prednost održava na dvocifrenom nivou. A kako je četvrtina odmicala, tako je italijanska ekipa još bolje povezivala redove i krenula da pogađa kako sa distance, tako i iz reketa. Klub iz zalivskog grada je tako sasvim zasluženo odneo pobedu iz Beograda, čak i prilično ubedljivo.
Za kraj, pomenimo samo da je samo Rašon Tomas u Partizanovom timu upisao dvocifren koštgeterski učinak pošto je ubacio 18 poena. Mada pohvale zaslužuje i Vil Mozli sa šest poena, sedam skokova i šest asistencija. Upropastio je utisak jedino sa šutem sa penala: samo 2/6.
Na drugoj strani, Mičel Vot je bio neuhvatljiv za crno-bele, pa je ubacio 27 poena, a pride imao po pet skokova i asistencija čime je sebi vrlo verovatno kupio mesto u petorki kola. Ostin Daje je pobedi doprineo sa 13, Džeremi Čepmen sa 12 poena, a Džulijan Stoun sa 10, ali i 11 skokova i sedam asistencija.
Ni nalik onom meču u Veneciji...

PARTIZAN – VENECIJA 69:83 (18:21, 21:16, 9:25, 21:21)

text:
Nine points for the quarter, problems under the rim and Partizan's first defeat at Eurocup
Venice celebrated in the middle of Belgrade with 83:69

05 Nov 2019

Unfortunately, the Partizan invincibility series at Eurocup has come to an end. The Black and Whites came across a motivated, combative and, above all, strong Venice team tonight in the Arena, who managed to inflict the Black and Whites' first defeat in Europe - 83-69 with a better game in the racquet and with a few threes in the decisive third quarter.
Venice had the advantage on the jump during most of the match, which made it difficult for Partizan basketball players to spend as they spent a lot of energy on the defensive. To make it all the more difficult for black and white, Venice began to serve a shot in the middle of the third quarter. It was in those moments that the Italian team made a crucial difference in this game, which it managed to preserve until the very end.
Even the great party of Rashon Thomas didn't help tonight. Simply, the black and whites missed too many opportunities to take this match in their own direction and Venice quite deservedly took the win.
Somewhat slower, Partizan basketball players entered the match against Venice. For three minutes, the black and whites were waiting for the first points when the black series was able to break Ognjen Jaramaz with a foul. The home team basketball players had big problems keeping the ball in the racket, so the Italians, via Wat and Udano, were able to break away at a quite solid score distance.



Andrea Trinkieri had to end the Venice series after five minutes of basketball. Although black and whites somewhat consolidated in the attack, there were still major problems in defense. The visiting players continued to score points after the offensive rebound.
However, in the very end of the first quarter, Partizan shot from a distance, so the black and whites after the triples of Zagorec and Paige, and then a very heavy hit by Peyners with contact nevertheless finished the first quarter on a positive note and had only three points behind.
Partizan continued to play with the same energy at the beginning of the second section. Venice tried to parry him, but it was evident that he was slowly starting to lose pace. A fantastic tandem in those moments consisted of Jeanis Payners and Rachon Thomas, who for the first time black-and-white peeled off to a slightly more tangible result advantage and forced visiting coach Walter de Rafaele to request a timeout.
He, too, has borne fruit, Venice has succeeded in reciprocating and at one point equalizing. However, the black and whites managed to win, again actively vying with the Italian champion, and on the big break they also had two points of advantage - 39:37.























The beginning of the second half seemed to have been mirrored over the first. Again Partizan made a number of mistakes in the construction of the rackets, allowing Venice to pick up a large number of offensive rebounds, and failed to correct it on the other side of the field. The Italians also started the shot in the third section, so Andrea Trinkieri sought a half-time in the middle of the quarter in order to somehow annoy his basketball players.
However, Venice still stood much better on the field energetically than Partizan basketball players. The Italians were better even after the requested minute of rest, they were also kicked from a distance, so they quickly managed to peel off even on a double-digit difference. Black and whites were also very poor on the free throw line, which was maximally used by the guest. Before the last ten minutes of basketball, Venice had as many as 14 points - 48:62.
Although Mozley and Thomas tried hard to knock black and whites off at the start of the last section, Venice continued to resist and maintain the advantage at double-digit levels. And as the quarter progressed, so did the Italian team tie the rows even better and set out to hit both from a distance and from the racket. The Gulf City club so deservedly took the win from Belgrade, even quite convincingly.
In the end, let's just mention that only Rashon Thomas on the Partizan team recorded a double-digit scoring performance after scoring 18 points. Although praiseworthy, Will Mosley also deserves six points, seven rebounds and six assists. It only ruined the impression with a penalty shootout: only 2/6.
Mitchell Watts, on the other hand, was elusive for the Black and Whites, scoring 27 points and five rebounds and assists, which made him very likely to buy a spot in the top five. Austin Daeye contributed 13 points, Jeremy Chapman with 12 points and Julian Stone with 10 but 11 rebounds and seven assists.
Not like that match in Venice ...

PARTIZAN - VENICE 69:83 (18:21, 21:16, 9:25, 21:21)
